meanings.definition: A lively dance in triple time.
meanings.sent1: The children performed joyful galliards at the school talent show.
meanings.sent2: The galliards were a popular form of entertainment in the Renaissance era.
meanings.sent3: During the party, the galliards caused everyone to laugh and clap along.
meanings.sent4: Her energy on the dance floor was like a galliards, full of life and rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The galliards were so vibrant and spirited that they left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.sent1: The royal court often enjoyed watching skilled dancers perform galliards.
meanings.sent2: Learning the galliards was an important part of a nobleman's education.
meanings.sent3: The galliards were so elegant that they made the other dances seem dull in comparison.
meanings.sent4: The galliards were like a graceful swan gliding across the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The galliards transported the audience back in time to the grandeur of the Renaissance period.

meanings.definition: A piece of music for this dance.
meanings.sent1: The musicians played a lively galliards that had everyone tapping their feet.
meanings.sent2: The galliards composed by the maestro was a masterpiece of rhythm and melody.
meanings.sent3: The galliards filled the hall with such joy that even the statues seemed to come alive.
meanings.sent4: The galliards echoed through the room like a cascade of musical notes.
meanings.sent5: The galliards resonated in the hearts of the listeners, stirring emotions of happiness and nostalgia.
